page.title: 01THE RIVER CREE ESTUARY
page.content: The area is a tidal flood plain of the River Cree, containing saltmarsh, poor grazing land and hills on one side (to the east) and moorland and saltmarsh (to the west) becoming water meadows further upstream. The town itself war built as a model village some 120 years ago, and consists of low-single storey granite houses in the main. There are one or two cottages dating from the early 1800's and indeed the High Street farms the A75 from Dumfrier to Stranraer, soon to be re-routed by the Creetown By-Pass. There is not a lot of work in the town except roadbuilding and the stone is quarried about 2km from the town. There is a notable museum of Gemstones with examples collected worldwide by the owners themselves. It is fairly popular as a stopping off place for discovering the area, there
